snippet: After an initially negative reaction, European markets and analysts found hope in the European Central Bank chief’s assurances on addressing the euro zone’s problems.
abstract: Economists, analysts and market participants continue to digest the assurances made by European Central Bank pres Mario Draghi that he is willing to resume the purchase of sovereign bonds at some point in the future in concert with the euro zone’s rescue fund; Prime Min Mariano Rajoy indicates that he will consider requesting such help as a way to reduce Spain’s interest rates

byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and RAPHAEL MINDER
byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from London and Raphael Minder from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: After an initially negative reaction, European markets and analysts found hope in the European Central Bank chief’s assurances on addressing the euro zone’s problems.

headline.seo: Europe Pauses to Consider Draghi’s Remarks
